About Me

Research Data Scientist with years of experience in healthcare and data analysis looking to work with progressive companies to solve operational and data analytical challenges. Achievements include designing and supporting a large HPC cluster for research and business intelligence purposes, utilized multi data sources to discover new actionable knowledge and reducing operational costs. Highly skilled in hypothesis testing, analytical process management, visual problem solving, and data story telling.

I am most skilled in: Problem Solving using Data and Overlanding

Papers | Publications

(IP) 30-day Readmission Rate for Congestive Heart Failure Discharges and Reasons for Readmission

2022

Heart failure is the most common admitting diagnosis in patients over the age of 65. Heart failure present an enormous economic burden and increasing risk to the aging population. Heart failure is directly associated with increased morbidity and also effects mental health such as depression.

Thesis (Honors) - Diversity of Minimotifs in human traits and disease.

2019

Minimotifs are vital for normal cell functions and will help bridge the gap between what has changed in an SNP and why that change is important. Understanding SNP effects on minimotifs and the resulting change in function could explain phenotypical changes seen in disease. The resulting intersection of the two domains found 879 results in which a minimotif plays a role in an SNP change. The 879 results can be further analyzed to show that 189 Distinct Strongest Risk Alleles and 150 distinct SNPs were uncovered.

Natural variability of minimotifs in 1092 people indicates that minimotifs are targets of evolution

Since the function of a short contiguous peptide minimotif can be introduced or eliminated by a single point mutation, these functional elements may be a source of human variation and a target of selection. We analyzed the variability of ∼300 000 minimotifs in 1092 human genomes from the 1000 Genomes Project.

github.com/sproogen

This is probably one of the greatest apps ever created, if you don't agree you're probably wrong.
